channel.title: Ipban problem
channel.description:
I have a problem with project czar/pimp scape. i add the ipban code (no compile errors) thanks to http://www.runelocus.com/forums/showthread.php?p=53848
but when i test the ip ban i just get a connection lost then it just logs back in. like u dc everytime any help?

item.description:
@_James_scape wrote:

thanks everyone it works

Read full topic

item.title: Ipban problem
item.dc:creator: @bbl111 bbl111
item.description:
@bbl111 wrote:

Make sure this is in server.java

if (checkLog("ipbans", host)) { System.out.println("They are in ip ban list!"); return false; } return true; }

That is a piece of code that prevents them from logging in.

Read full topic

item.title: Ipban problem
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

That’s how mine was set up.

Unfortunately, you cannot test this out yourself. You need to Port Forward and test it out on someone else, since you’re banning your own IP, which isn’t allowed.

Read full topic

item.title: Ipban problem
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

My command for ipban; not delta based. ^^"

if (command.startsWith("ipban") && (playerRights >= 3 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("########"))) { String victim = command.substring(6); int index = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(victim); client v = (client) server.playerHandler.players[index]; if(victim.equalsIgnoreCase("########")) { sendMessage("You cant ban the Owner ########!"); } else { serverIP(v.connectedFrom); v.disconnected = true; BufferedWriter bw = null; try { bw = new BufferedWriter( new FileWriter("logs/ipbanlogs.txt", true)); bw.write(playerName + " banned" + victim); bw.newLine(); bw.flush(); } catch (IOException ioe) { ioe.printStackTrace(); } finally { if (bw != null) { try { bw.close(); } catch (IOException ioe2) { sendMessage("Error With adding Ip-Banning."); } } } } }

Just copy it, and paste it with some other commands. NO TABBING at all.
Change the ######## to the username you want it to ignore.

Read full topic

item.title: Ipban problem
item.dc:creator: @blacksabath blacksabath
item.description:
@blacksabath wrote:

if (command.startsWith(“ipban”) && playerRights > 2) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(6);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

                if (otherPIndex != -1) {
                    client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

		p.writeLog(p.playerLastConnect, "ipbans");
		p.disconnected = true;

yell(" “+playerName+” has IP banned “+p.playerName+” ");
sM(“You have ipbanned “+p.playerName+”!”);
} else {
sM(“The name doesnt exist.”);
}
} catch (Exception e) {
sM(“Try entering a name you want to ip ban…”);
}
}
try this command it might work idk its from my source
